uncertain_vulns.title: Command Injection in executeCommand method
uncertain_vulns.description: The `executeCommand` method takes user input and uses it directly in the `Runtime.getRuntime().exec()` call, which can lead to command injection if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs a malicious command like `"rm -rf /"`, this could delete the entire file system.
uncertain_vulns.reason: Requires manual review (conservative: marked as valid)

uncertain_vulns.title: SQL Injection in queryDatabase method
uncertain_vulns.description: The `queryDatabase` method constructs a SQL query with user input directly, which can lead to SQL injection if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs `"admin' OR '1'='1"` as the username, this could bypass the authentication check and access all users in the database.
uncertain_vulns.reason: Requires manual review (conservative: marked as valid)

uncertain_vulns.title: XSS in executeCommand method
uncertain_vulns.description: The `executeCommand` method uses the user input directly in the `Runtime.getRuntime().exec()` call, which can lead to cross-site scripting if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs `"<script>alert('XSS')</script>"`, this could execute arbitrary JavaScript code on the client side.
uncertain_vulns.reason: Requires manual review (conservative: marked as valid)

uncertain_vulns.title: Path Traversal in queryDatabase method
uncertain_vulns.description: The `queryDatabase` method constructs a SQL query with user input directly, which can lead to path traversal if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs `"../../etc/passwd"` as the username, this could access sensitive files on the server.
uncertain_vulns.reason: Requires manual review (conservative: marked as valid)

uncertain_vulns.reason: Requires manual review (conservative: marked as valid)

uncertain_vulns.title: SQL Injection in queryUser function

This is vulnerable to SQL injection because the username is directly concatenated into the query string without proper sanitization. An attacker could manipulate the username to execute arbitrary SQL commands on the database.

false_positive_vulns.title: Integer Overflow in Price Calculation
false_positive_vulns.description:
In the `checkout` function, there is no overflow check on the multiplication of `quantity` and `price`. This can lead to an integer overflow if the user sets `quantity` to a very large number (e.g., \(2^{31}\)), resulting in a negative total. If the total exceeds zero, the customer will be charged, which could be exploited for financial gain.

uncertain_vulns.title: Command Injection in executeCommand method
uncertain_vulns.description: The `executeCommand` method takes user input and uses it directly in the `Runtime.getRuntime().exec()` call, which can lead to command injection if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs a malicious command like `"rm -rf /"`, this could delete the entire file system.
uncertain_vulns.reason: Requires manual review (conservative: marked as valid)

uncertain_vulns.title: SQL Injection in queryDatabase method
uncertain_vulns.description: The `queryDatabase` method constructs a SQL query with user input directly, which can lead to SQL injection if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs `"admin' OR '1'='1"` as the username, this could bypass the authentication check and access all users in the database.
uncertain_vulns.reason: Requires manual review (conservative: marked as valid)

uncertain_vulns.title: XSS in executeCommand method
uncertain_vulns.description: The `executeCommand` method uses the user input directly in the `Runtime.getRuntime().exec()` call, which can lead to cross-site scripting if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs `"<script>alert('XSS')</script>"`, this could execute arbitrary JavaScript code on the client side.
uncertain_vulns.reason: Requires manual review (conservative: marked as valid)

uncertain_vulns.title: Path Traversal in queryDatabase method
uncertain_vulns.description: The `queryDatabase` method constructs a SQL query with user input directly, which can lead to path traversal if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs `"../../etc/passwd"` as the username, this could access sensitive files on the server.
uncertain_vulns.reason: Requires manual review (conservative: marked as valid)

false_positive_vulns.title: Integer Overflow in Price Calculation
false_positive_vulns.description:
In the `checkout` function, there is no overflow check on the multiplication of `quantity` and `price`. This can lead to an integer overflow if the user sets `quantity` to a very large number (e.g., \(2^{31}\)), resulting in a negative total. If the total exceeds zero, the customer will be charged, which could be exploited for financial gain.

valid_vulns.title: User data flows into this manually-constructed SQL string. User data can be safely inserted into SQL strings using prepared statements or an object-relational mapper (ORM). Manually-constructed SQL strings is a possible indicator of SQL injection, which could let an attacker steal or manipulate data from the database. Instead, use prepared statements (`$mysqli->prepare("INSERT INTO test(id, label) VALUES (?, ?)");`) or a safe library.

uncertain_vulns.title: Detected user input used to manually construct a SQL string. This is usually bad practice because manual construction could accidentally result in a SQL injection. An attacker could use a SQL injection to steal or modify contents of the database. Instead, use a parameterized query which is available by default in most database engines. Alternatively, consider using an object-relational mapper (ORM) such as ActiveRecord which will protect your queries.
